stanza.line: My tongue tied muse in manners holds herstill
While comments of your praise richlycompiled
And precious phrase by all the Musesfiled
I think good thoughts whilst other write good words
And like unlettered clerk still cryamen
To every hymn that able spirit affords
In polished form of well refinedpen
Hearing you praised I say tis so tistrue
And to the most of praise add somethingmore
But that is in my thought whose love toyou
Though words come hindmost holds his rankbefore
Then others for the breath of wordsrespect
Me for my dumb thoughts speaking ineffect
